meanings.definition: To walk slowly and heavily, especially over a long distance.
meanings.sent1: The tired hiker was outplodding through the thick forest.
meanings.sent2: The elephant was outplodding across the savanna.
meanings.sent3: The sloth was outplodding to the finish line in the slowest race ever.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to be outplodding as he waited for the test results.
meanings.sent5: The old steam engine was outplodding up the steep hill, chugging along slowly.

meanings.definition: To surpass in plodding or moving slowly.
meanings.sent1: Despite his fatigue, he was outplodding his friends in the marathon.
meanings.sent2: The tortoise was outplodding the hare in the race.
meanings.sent3: The snail was outplodding the caterpillar in the slowest crawl competition.
meanings.sent4: The glacier was outplodding the river, moving imperceptibly slow.
meanings.sent5: The elderly man was outplodding the youngsters in the patience game, showing unmatched perseverance.
